trustfund:
TF021435-MICROENTERPRISE PROJECT,TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF023107-PHRD-FINANCIAL SEC. DEEPENING
            & INTERME.

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            rated as satisfactory. Main lessons learned include: 1) The
            project has demonstrated that financing of microenterprises
            is sustainable. 2) Micro and small enterprise (MSE) sector
            can be developed successfully by providing financing at
            market rates and without subsidies. 3) MSE entrepreneurs
            performance concerning repayment of loans is satisfactory
            and better than recoveries from medium-large scale industry.
            4) Leasing is a viable option for medium-term credit. 5)
            Nongovernmental organizations (NGOs) have played an
            effective role in meeting funding needs of microenterprises.
            6) Women can play their due role in development of MSEs
            provided credit is made available. 7) Private sector
            financial institutions have proved to be effective
            intermediaries in development of the MSE sector. 8) Prudent
            selection of financial intermediaries is key to project
            success. 9) Clear identification of the target sector's
            characteristics should be part of design of future projects.
            10) Poverty reduction is vital for eradication of child
            labor and a practical concerted role can be played by NGOs.
